p: An inflammatory response is a symptom of many diseases caused by bacteria or viral infection, physical stimuli, chemical stimuli, and trauma and is a complex biological response to harmful stimuli [ 32]. Lipopolysaccharide (LPS) is a component of the cell wall of Gram-negative bacteria that causes inflammation by activating MAPK, nuclear factor-kB (NF-kB), and activator protein-1 (AP-1) signalling pathways [ 18]. In the inflammatory response of cells, COX-2 inhibition exerts a strong anti-inflammatory effect [ 33]. COX-2 overexpression can also be used as an inflammatory model.
